Summary

I work full-time at the Centre for Innovation in Learning and Teaching (CILT), at the UCT, as an Online Learning Environments Developer. I also form part of the leadership on an open source Lecture Recording platform, Opencast Matterhorn, used by various universities across the world.

I enjoy learning about technology and investigating how it can improve people's lives. I love research, I believe in understanding computer science fundamentals and building on those fundamentals. I am currently a part-time Masters in Computer Science student at the University of Cape Town (UCT).

experience

  1. 2012-Present

    Committer • Opencast Matterhorn Project

    • As a committer - drive, manage, and govern the product.
    • Active committer to the Opencast Matterhorn Project. Contributed numerous patches.
    • Review other committers patches and merge fixes.
    • Have filed numerous bug issues.

  2. 2011-Present

    Online Learning Environments Developer • CILT, UCT

    • Responsible for research, deployment, maintenance and support of large scale Learning Management Systems (LMS) at the UCT.
    • A lead developer and systems administrator on the UCT Lecture Recording project, and was involved in the deployment of the Opencast Matterhorn Lecture Recording system, that went into production in February 2012. There have been over 3900 published recordings to date, 34 venues equipped and over 190 courses setup.
    • Upgrades and continuous code changes for the UCT Lecture recording project. This includes the Opencast Matterhorn backend (running on SLES VMs), capture devices (running on Ubuntu) as well as the various dependencies such as FFmpeg, Gstreamer etc.
    • UI related development for the LMS, Vula (based on the open source platform Sakai), on a per need basis.
    • Facilitated the integration of Vula and Opencast Matterhorn, at the UCT, by developing the Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) UI that students use to view and download recordings within Vula. This UI has been customised by other universities to provide content to their students.
    • Also Used LTI and the Opencast Matterhorn Rest APIs to develop views within Vula that allow lecturers to self manage their recordings, schedule them, as well as upload recordings.
    • Management of the Opencast Matterhorn distributed server cluster (backend) - admin and engage node, worker nodes, ingest nodes, Red5 streaming server and MySQL database server. This also includes storage requirements, logging, VM resourcing (involves liasing with the ICTS department), etc.
    • Scaling up the nodes. Our cluster has grown steadily to support the growing needs of the project.
    • System monitoring. I ensure that the system runs optimally. Developed the IP camera dashboard for monitoring IP cameras used for the Lecture Recording Project. Also setup the Galicater Dashboard for monitoring all lecture recording devices.
    • Migrated the current UCT Matterhorn code base from SVN to Git. Updated our build scripts to reflect the new changes and updated to the new Git branching structure.
    • Setup the Continuous Integration (CI) Server to work with our new Git repoistory.
    • Installation, configuration management (using Ansible) and maintainence of lecture capture devices. This includes the reference capture agents as well as the new Galicaster capture agents.
    • Constant wiki updates or Jira ticket updates for documenting work done on the project.
    • Work closely with the community and external support companies to ensure the growth of the Lecture recording project at the UCT.

  3. 2010-2011

    Back-end Developer / QA Engineer • Unboxed Consulting (PTY) Ltd

    • Quality Assurance Engineer on the SCRUM team that launched the new bespoke Channel5 UK website. We were a distributed team, split between Cape Town, South Africa and London, UK.
    • Ruby back-end developer for the Big Brother UK project, for Channel 5.
    • Ruby back-end developer involved in the code refactoring exercise for the Timesheets application, used by Unboxed, including the addition of extra functionalities and enhancement of user experience.

  4. 2007-2010

    Analyst Developer / MIS Officer • MIS, Mimosa Mining Company.

    • Ensured 24-hour availabity of the platinum mine's Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
    • Designed and developed the Intranet application that was used mine-wide to serve over 2000 employees. The application served up-to-date documents and daily production statistics.
    • Developed a Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) system that was used to track PPE usage in high PPE-usage departments.
    • Supervised the effective maintenance, upgrades and support for the newly launched HR system "Absalom HR".
    • An active member of the team that ensured our department, Management Information Systems (MIS), had all the necessary documentation to meet the health and safety requirements.
    • Appointed as one of the mine-wide ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 internal auditors in 2010, in preparation for the external audit, we were successfully recertified that year.

  5. 2006-2007

    Graduate Trainee • National Social Security Authority (NSSA)

    • Designed and redeveloped the parastatal's website.

  6. 2006-2006

    Developer • CyberplexAfrica

    • Developed a banner management system that was used by the two most popular, most visited, newspaper sites in the country, The Herald and The Chronicle, to serve advertisements on their websites.

Technical skills

I am a software developer and a *nix systems administrator, with an affinity for learning. I have, however managed to gain proficiency in certain languages and paradigms over the years.

  • Ruby (proficient) and related frameworks such as Sinatra and Rails.
  • JavaScript (proficient) and libraries like jQuery.
  • Go(lang) - currently using it on my MSc. thesis project.
  • Bash.

My editor of choice is Emacs and I use LaTeX for my academic work. I also have experience with other technologies, practices and platforms such as :

  • *nix, Mac OSX, Windows
  • MSSQL, MySQL, Redis
  • Apache, Nginx, Thin
  • SoX, FFmpeg, openRTSP, Gstreamer
  • Ansible
  • Java, PHP, Scheme, C, Erlang
  • Regular expressions
  • Maven, Rake, Make
  • Git, SVN
  • Jenkins, Travis CI
  • Scrum, TDD.
